techmeme.title: As the EU's AI Act takes effect in August, critics say the law is undercooked and regulators left out essential details needed to give clarity to businesses (Javier Espinoza/Financial Times)
Analysis: Intel's VC arm is one of the most active foreign investors in Chinese AI and chip startups; Intel Capital owns stakes in 43 Chinese tech startups (Financial Times)
Sources: Google offered CISPE ~€455M worth of Google Cloud licenses and €14M in cash in a deal for CISPE to maintain its antitrust complaint against Microsoft (Samuel Stolton/Bloomberg)
Sources: China's CAC requires AI companies to prepare between 20K and 70K questions designed to test whether their AI models produce safe answers before release (Liza Lin/Wall Street Journal)
Twitch streamer Ibai Llanos' fourth boxing tournament in Madrid, with matches between influencers, set a record 3.85M+ concurrent viewers at its peak on July 13 (Adam Bumas/Wired)
